column1: '''Daphne R. Castell''' ([[1929]]<ref name=FJ>{{webcite|author=[[Colin Duriez]]|articleurl=http://www.festivalintheshire.com/journal1bdx/castell.html|articlename=Daphne Castell: An early fan who had a momentous interview with J.R.R. Tolkien|dated=|website=[http://www.festivalintheshire.com/journal1bdx/index.html ''Festival in the Shire Journal''
column2: Issue 1]|accessed=7 May 2012}}</ref> - [[3 August]] [[1983]]<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/ea.cgi?11442|articlename=Daphne Castell - Summary Bibliography|dated=|website=[http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/index.cgi The Internet Speculative Fiction Database]|accessed=7 May 2012}}</ref>) was a British science-fiction writer and librarian. During the 1950s at Oxford University
column3: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] supervised her thesis about Thomas Chatterton
column4: which was never completed.<ref name=FJ/><ref name=CGC/> She married Malcolm Cloke in 1955.<ref name=FJ/>

column1: In late spring or early summer 1966
column2: Castell conducted an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview with Tolkien]] for the magazine ''New Worlds''.<ref name=CGC>{{CG|C}}

column1: **"Talking to a Maker of Modern Myths"
*[[1966]]: [[The Christian Science Monitor (11 August 1966)|''The Christian Science Monitor'' (11 August 1966)]]
**"Tolkien on Tolkien: Making of a Myth"
*"[http://www.festivalintheshire.com/journal1bdx/castell.html Daphne Castell: An early fan who had a momentous interview with J.R.R. Tolkien]" by [[Colin Duriez]]
